00034 /** @file type.h
00035     @brief File with declarations for classes related to type representation
00036 */
00037 
00038 #ifndef ISPC_TYPE_H
00039 #define ISPC_TYPE_H 1
00040 
00041 #include "ispc.h"
00042 #include <llvm/Type.h>
00043 #include <llvm/DerivedTypes.h>
00044 
00045 class ConstExpr;
00046 class StructType;
00047 
00048 /** @brief Interface class that defines the type abstraction.
00049 
00050     Abstract base class that defines the interface that must be implemented
00051     for all types in the language.
00052  */
00053 class Type {
00054 public:
00055     /** Returns true if the underlying type is boolean.  In other words,
00056         this is true for individual bools and for short-vectors with
00057         underlying bool type, but not for arrays of bools. */
00058     virtual bool IsBoolType() const = 0;
00059 
00060     /** Returns true if the underlying type is float or double.  In other
00061         words, this is true for individual floats/doubles and for
00062         short-vectors of them, but not for arrays of them. */
00063     virtual bool IsFloatType() const = 0;
00064 
00065     /** Returns true if the underlying type is an integer type.  In other
00066         words, this is true for individual integers and for short-vectors
00067         of integer types, but not for arrays of integer types. */
00068     virtual bool IsIntType() const = 0;
00069 
00070     /** Returns true if the underlying type is unsigned.  In other words,
00071         this is true for unsigned integers and short vectors of unsigned
00072         integer types. */
00073     virtual bool IsUnsignedType() const = 0;
00074 
00075     /** Returns true if this type is 'const'-qualified. */
00076     virtual bool IsConstType() const = 0;
00077     
00078     /** Returns true if the underlying type is a float or integer type. */
00079     bool IsNumericType() const { return IsFloatType() || IsIntType(); }
00080 
00081     /** Returns true if the underlying type is uniform */
00082     virtual bool IsUniformType() const = 0;
00083 
00084     /** Returns true if the underlying type is varying */
00085     bool IsVaryingType() const { return !IsUniformType(); }
00086 
00087     /** Return a "uniform" instance of this type.  If the type is already
00088         uniform, its "this" pointer will be returned. */
00089     virtual const Type *GetAsUniformType() const = 0;
00090 
00091     /** Return a "varying" instance of this type.  If the type is already
00092         uniform, its "this" pointer will be returned. */
00093     virtual const Type *GetAsVaryingType() const = 0;
00094 
00095     /** If this is a signed integer type, return the unsigned version of
00096         the type.  Otherwise, return the original type. */
00097     virtual const Type *GetAsUnsignedType() const;
00098 
00099     /** Returns the basic root type of the given type.  For example, for an
00100         array or short-vector, this returns the element type.  For a struct
00101         or atomic type, it returns itself. */
00102     virtual const Type *GetBaseType() const = 0;
00103 
00104     /** If this is a reference type, returns the type it is referring to.
00105         For all other types, just returns its own type. */
00106     virtual const Type *GetReferenceTarget() const;
00107 
00108     /** Return a new type representing the current type laid out in
00109         width-wide SOA (structure of arrays) format. */
00110     virtual const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const = 0;
00111 
00112     /** Get a const version of this type.  If it's already const, then the old 
00113         Type pointer is returned. */
00114     virtual const Type *GetAsConstType() const = 0;
00115 
00116     /** Get a non-const version of this type.  If it's already not const,
00117         then the old Type pointer is returned. */
00118     virtual const Type *GetAsNonConstType() const = 0;
00119 
00120     /** Returns a text representation of the type (for example, for use in
00121         warning and error messages). */
00122     virtual std::string GetString() const = 0;
00123 
00124     /** Returns a string that represents the mangled type (for use in
00125         mangling function symbol names for function overloading).  The
00126         various Types implementations of this method should collectively
00127         ensure that all of them use mangling schemes that are guaranteed
00128         not to clash. */
00129     virtual std::string Mangle() const = 0;
00130 
00131     /** Returns a string that is the declaration of the same type in C
00132         syntax. */
00133     virtual std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const = 0;
00134 
00135     /** Returns the LLVM type corresponding to this ispc type */
00136     virtual LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const = 0;
00137 
00138     /** Returns the DIType (LLVM's debugging information structure),
00139         corresponding to this type. */
00140     virtual llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const = 0;
00141 
00142     /** Checks two types for equality.  Returns true if they are exactly
00143         the same, false otherwise. */
00144     static bool Equal(const Type *a, const Type *b);
00145 
00146     /** Given two types, returns the least general Type that is more general
00147         than both of them.  (i.e. that can represent their values without
00148         any loss of data.)  If there is no such Type, return NULL.
00149 
00150         @param type0        First of the two types
00151         @param type1        Second of the two types
00152         @param pos          Source file position where the general type is
00153                             needed.
00154         @param reason       String describing the context of why the general
00155                             type is needed (e.g. "+ operator").
00156         @param forceVarying If \c true, then make sure that the returned 
00157                             type is "varying".
00158         @param vecSize      The vector size of the returned type.  If non-zero,
00159                             the returned type will be a VectorType of the
00160                             more general type with given length.  If zero,
00161                             this parameter has no effect.
00162         @return             The more general type, based on the provided parameters.
00163 
00164         @todo the vecSize and forceVarying parts of this should probably be
00165         factored out and done separately in the cases when needed.
00166         
00167     */
00168     static const Type *MoreGeneralType(const Type *type0, const Type *type1,
00169                                        SourcePos pos, const char *reason,
00170                                        bool forceVarying = false, int vecSize = 0);
00171 };
00172 
00173 
00174 /** @brief AtomicType represents basic types like floats, ints, etc.  
00175 
00176     AtomicTypes can be either uniform or varying.  Unique instances of all
00177     of the possible <tt>AtomicType</tt>s are available in the static members
00178     like AtomicType::UniformInt32.  It is thus possible to compare
00179     AtomicTypes for equality with simple pointer equality tests; this is
00180     not true for the other Type implementations.
00181  */
00182 class AtomicType : public Type {
00183 public:
00184     bool IsUniformType() const;
00185     bool IsBoolType() const;
00186     bool IsFloatType() const;
00187     bool IsIntType() const;
00188     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00189     bool IsConstType() const;
00190 
00191     /** For AtomicTypes, the base type is just the same as the AtomicType
00192         itself. */
00193     const AtomicType *GetBaseType() const;
00194     const AtomicType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00195     const AtomicType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00196     const AtomicType *GetAsUnsignedType() const;
00197     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00198     const AtomicType *GetAsConstType() const;
00199     const AtomicType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00200 
00201     std::string GetString() const;
00202     std::string Mangle() const;
00203     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00204 
00205     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00206     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00207 
00208     /** This enumerator records the basic types that AtomicTypes can be 
00209         built from.  */
00210     enum BasicType {
00211         TYPE_VOID,
00212         TYPE_BOOL,
00213         TYPE_INT8,
00214         TYPE_UINT8,
00215         TYPE_INT16,
00216         TYPE_UINT16,
00217         TYPE_INT32,
00218         TYPE_UINT32,
00219         TYPE_FLOAT,
00220         TYPE_INT64,
00221         TYPE_UINT64,
00222         TYPE_DOUBLE,
00223     };
00224 
00225     const BasicType basicType;
00226 
00227     static const AtomicType *UniformBool, *VaryingBool;
00228     static const AtomicType *UniformInt8, *VaryingInt8;
00229     static const AtomicType *UniformInt16, *VaryingInt16;
00230     static const AtomicType *UniformInt32, *VaryingInt32;
00231     static const AtomicType *UniformUInt8, *VaryingUInt8;
00232     static const AtomicType *UniformUInt16, *VaryingUInt16;
00233     static const AtomicType *UniformUInt32, *VaryingUInt32;
00234     static const AtomicType *UniformFloat, *VaryingFloat;
00235     static const AtomicType *UniformInt64, *VaryingInt64;
00236     static const AtomicType *UniformUInt64, *VaryingUInt64;
00237     static const AtomicType *UniformDouble, *VaryingDouble;
00238     static const AtomicType *UniformConstBool, *VaryingConstBool;
00239     static const AtomicType *UniformConstInt8, *VaryingConstInt8;
00240     static const AtomicType *UniformConstInt16, *VaryingConstInt16;
00241     static const AtomicType *UniformConstInt32, *VaryingConstInt32;
00242     static const AtomicType *UniformConstUInt8, *VaryingConstUInt8;
00243     static const AtomicType *UniformConstUInt16, *VaryingConstUInt16;
00244     static const AtomicType *UniformConstUInt32, *VaryingConstUInt32;
00245     static const AtomicType *UniformConstFloat, *VaryingConstFloat;
00246     static const AtomicType *UniformConstInt64, *VaryingConstInt64;
00247     static const AtomicType *UniformConstUInt64, *VaryingConstUInt64;
00248     static const AtomicType *UniformConstDouble, *VaryingConstDouble;
00249     static const AtomicType *Void;
00250 
00251 private:
00252     const bool isUniform;
00253     const bool isConst;
00254     AtomicType(BasicType basicType, bool isUniform, bool isConst);
00255 };

00258 /** @brief Type implementation for enumerated types
00259  */
00260 class EnumType : public Type {
00261 public:
00262     /** Constructor for anonymous enumerated types */
00263     EnumType(SourcePos pos);
00264     /** Constructor for named enumerated types */
00265     EnumType(const char *name, SourcePos pos);
00266 
00267     bool IsUniformType() const;
00268     bool IsBoolType() const;
00269     bool IsFloatType() const;
00270     bool IsIntType() const;
00271     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00272     bool IsConstType() const;
00273 
00274     const EnumType *GetBaseType() const;
00275     const EnumType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00276     const EnumType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00277     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00278     const EnumType *GetAsConstType() const;
00279     const EnumType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00280 
00281     std::string GetString() const;
00282     std::string Mangle() const;
00283     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00284 
00285     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00286     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00287 
00288     /** Provides the enumerators defined in the enum definition. */
00289     void SetEnumerators(const std::vector<Symbol *> &enumerators);
00290     /** Returns the total number of enuemrators in this enum type. */
00291     int GetEnumeratorCount() const;
00292     /** Returns the symbol for the given enumerator number. */
00293     const Symbol *GetEnumerator(int i) const;
00294 
00295     const SourcePos pos;
00296 
00297 private:
00298     const std::string name;
00299     bool isUniform, isConst;
00300     std::vector<Symbol *> enumerators;
00301 };

00304 /** @brief Abstract base class for types that represent collections of
00305     other types.
00306 
00307     This is a common base class that StructTypes, ArrayTypes, and
00308     VectorTypes all inherit from.
00309 */ 
00310 class CollectionType : public Type {
00311 public:
00312     /** Returns the total number of elements in the collection. */
00313     virtual int GetElementCount() const = 0;
00314 
00315     /** Returns the type of the element given by index.  (The value of
00316         index must be between 0 and GetElementCount()-1.
00317      */
00318     virtual const Type *GetElementType(int index) const = 0;
00319 };
00320 
00321 
00322 /** @brief Abstract base class for types that represent sequences
00323 
00324     SequentialType is an abstract base class that adds interface routines
00325     for types that represent linear sequences of other types (i.e., arrays
00326     and vectors).
00327  */
00328 class SequentialType : public CollectionType {
00329 public:
00330     /** Returns the Type of the elements that the sequence stores; for
00331         SequentialTypes, all elements have the same type . */
00332     virtual const Type *GetElementType() const = 0;
00333 
00334     /** SequentialType provides an implementation of this CollectionType
00335         method, just passing the query on to the GetElementType(void)
00336         implementation, since all of the elements of a SequentialType have
00337         the same type.
00338      */
00339     const Type *GetElementType(int index) const;
00340 };
00341 
00342 
00343 /** @brief One-dimensional array type.
00344 
00345     ArrayType represents a one-dimensional array of instances of some other
00346     type.  (Multi-dimensional arrays are represented by ArrayTypes that in
00347     turn hold ArrayTypes as their child types.)  
00348 */
00349 class ArrayType : public SequentialType {
00350 public:
00351     /** An ArrayType is created by providing the type of the elements that
00352         it stores, and the SOA width to use in laying out the array in
00353         memory.
00354 
00355         @param elementType  Type of the array elements
00356         @param numElements  Total number of elements in the array.  This
00357                             parameter may be zero, in which case this is an
00358                             "unsized" array type.  (Arrays of specific size
00359                             can be converted to unsized arrays to be passed
00360                             to functions that take array parameters, for
00361                             example).
00362      */
00363     ArrayType(const Type *elementType, int numElements);
00364 
00365     bool IsUniformType() const;
00366     bool IsBoolType() const;
00367     bool IsFloatType() const;
00368     bool IsIntType() const;
00369     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00370     bool IsConstType() const;
00371 
00372     const Type *GetBaseType() const;
00373     const ArrayType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00374     const ArrayType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00375     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00376     const ArrayType *GetAsConstType() const;
00377     const ArrayType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00378 
00379     std::string GetString() const;
00380     std::string Mangle() const;
00381     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00382 
00383     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00384     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00385 
00386     /** This method returns the total number of elements in the array,
00387         including all dimensions if this is a multidimensional array. */
00388     int TotalElementCount() const;
00389 
00390     int GetElementCount() const;
00391     const Type *GetElementType() const;
00392 
00393     /** Returns a new array of the same child type, but with the given
00394         length. */
00395     virtual ArrayType *GetSizedArray(int length) const;
00396 
00397 private:
00398     friend class SOAArrayType;
00399     /** Type of the elements of the array. */
00400     const Type * const child;
00401     /** Number of elements in the array. */
00402     const int numElements;
00403 };
00404 
00405 
00406 /** @brief "Structure of arrays" array type.
00407 
00408     This type represents an array with elements of a structure type,
00409     "SOA-ized" to some width w.  This corresponds to replicating the struct
00410     element types w times and then having an array of size/w of these
00411     widened structs.  This memory layout often makes it possible to access
00412     data with regular vector loads, rather than gathers that are needed
00413     with "AOS" (array of structures) layout.
00414 
00415     @todo Native support for SOA stuff is still a work in progres...
00416  */
00417 class SOAArrayType : public ArrayType {
00418 public:
00419     /**
00420        SOAType constructor.
00421 
00422        @param elementType  Type of the array elements.  Must be a StructType.
00423        @param numElements  Total number of elements in the array.  This
00424                            parameter may be zero, in which case this is an
00425                            "unsized" array type.  (Arrays of specific size
00426                            can be converted to unsized arrays to be passed
00427                            to functions that take array parameters, for
00428                            example).
00429        @param soaWidth     If non-zero, this gives the SOA width to use in
00430                            laying out the array data in memory.  (This value
00431                            must be a power of two).  For example, if the
00432                            array's element type is: 
00433                            <tt>struct { uniform float x, y, z; }</tt>,
00434                            the SOA width is four, and the number of elements
00435                            is 12, then the array will be laid out in memory
00436                            as xxxxyyyyzzzzxxxxyyyyzzzzxxxxyyyyzzzz.
00437     */
00438     SOAArrayType(const StructType *elementType, int numElements, 
00439                  int soaWidth);
00440 
00441     const SOAArrayType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00442     const SOAArrayType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00443     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00444     const SOAArrayType *GetAsConstType() const;
00445     const SOAArrayType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00446 
00447     std::string GetString() const;
00448     std::string Mangle() const;
00449     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00450 
00451     int TotalElementCount() const;
00452 
00453     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00454     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00455 
00456     SOAArrayType *GetSizedArray(int size) const;
00457 
00458 private:
00459     /** This member variable records the rate at which the structure
00460         elements are replicated. */
00461     const int soaWidth;
00462 
00463     /** Returns a regular ArrayType with the struct type's elements widened
00464         out and with correspondingly fewer array elements. */
00465     const ArrayType *soaType() const;
00466 };
00467 
00468 
00469 /** @brief A (short) vector of atomic types.
00470 
00471     VectorType is used to represent a fixed-size array of elements of an
00472     AtomicType.  Vectors are similar to arrays in that they support
00473     indexing of the elements, but have two key differences.  First, all
00474     arithmetic and logical operations that are value for the element type
00475     can be performed on corresponding VectorTypes (as long as the two
00476     VectorTypes have the same size). Second, VectorTypes of uniform
00477     elements are laid out in memory aligned to the target's vector size;
00478     this allows them to be packed 'horizontally' into vector registers.
00479  */
00480 class VectorType : public SequentialType {
00481 public:
00482     VectorType(const AtomicType *base, int size);
00483 
00484     bool IsUniformType() const;
00485     bool IsBoolType() const;
00486     bool IsFloatType() const;
00487     bool IsIntType() const;
00488     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00489     bool IsConstType() const;
00490 
00491     const Type *GetBaseType() const;
00492     const VectorType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00493     const VectorType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00494     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00495     const VectorType *GetAsConstType() const;
00496     const VectorType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00497 
00498     std::string GetString() const;
00499     std::string Mangle() const;
00500     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00501 
00502     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00503     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00504 
00505     int GetElementCount() const;
00506     const AtomicType *GetElementType() const;
00507 
00508 private:
00509     /** Base type that the vector holds elements of */
00510     const AtomicType * const base;
00511     /** Number of elements in the vector */
00512     const int numElements;
00513 
00514     /** Returns the number of elements stored in memory for the vector.
00515         For uniform vectors, this is rounded up so that the number of
00516         elements evenly divides the target's native vector width. */
00517     int getVectorMemoryCount() const;
00518 };
00519 
00520 
00521 /** @brief Representation of a structure holding a number of members.
00522  */
00523 class StructType : public CollectionType {
00524 public:
00525     StructType(const std::string &name, const std::vector<const Type *> &elts, 
00526                const std::vector<std::string> &eltNames, 
00527                const std::vector<SourcePos> &eltPositions, bool isConst, 
00528                bool isUniform, SourcePos pos);
00529 
00530     bool IsUniformType() const;
00531     bool IsBoolType() const;
00532     bool IsFloatType() const;
00533     bool IsIntType() const;
00534     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00535     bool IsConstType() const;
00536 
00537     const Type *GetBaseType() const;
00538     const StructType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00539     const StructType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00540     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00541     const StructType *GetAsConstType() const;
00542     const StructType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00543 
00544     std::string GetString() const;
00545     std::string Mangle() const;
00546     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00547 
00548     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00549     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00550 
00551     /** Returns the type of the structure element with the given name (if any).
00552         Returns NULL if there is no such named element. */
00553     const Type *GetElementType(const std::string &name) const;
00554 
00555     /** Returns the type of the i'th structure element.  The value of \c i must
00556         be between 0 and NumElements()-1. */
00557     const Type *GetElementType(int i) const;
00558 
00559     /** Returns which structure element number (starting from zero) that
00560         has the given name.  If there is no such element, return -1. */
00561     int GetElementNumber(const std::string &name) const;
00562 
00563     /** Returns the name of the i'th element of the structure. */
00564     const std::string GetElementName(int i) const { return elementNames[i]; }
00565     
00566     /** Returns the total number of elements in the structure. */
00567     int GetElementCount() const { return int(elementTypes.size()); }
00568 
00569     /** Returns the name of the structure type.  (e.g. struct Foo -> "Foo".) */
00570     const std::string &GetStructName() const { return name; }
00571 
00572 private:
00573     const std::string name;
00574     /** The types of the struct elements.  Note that we store these with
00575         uniform/varying exactly as they were declared in the source file.
00576         (In other words, even if this struct has a varying qualifier and
00577         thus all of its members are going to be widened out to be varying,
00578         we still store any members that were declared as uniform as uniform
00579         types in the elementTypes array, converting them to varying as
00580         needed in the implementation.)  This is so that if we later need to
00581         make a uniform version of the struct, we've maintained the original
00582         information about the member types.
00583      */
00584     const std::vector<const Type *> elementTypes;
00585     const std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
00586     /** Source file position at which each structure element declaration
00587         appeared. */
00588     const std::vector<SourcePos> elementPositions;
00589     const bool isUniform;
00590     const bool isConst;
00591     const SourcePos pos;
00592 };
00593 
00594 
00595 /** @brief Type representing a reference to another (non-reference) type.
00596  */
00597 class ReferenceType : public Type {
00598 public:
00599     ReferenceType(const Type *targetType, bool isConst);
00600 
00601     bool IsUniformType() const;
00602     bool IsBoolType() const;
00603     bool IsFloatType() const;
00604     bool IsIntType() const;
00605     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00606     bool IsConstType() const;
00607 
00608     const Type *GetBaseType() const;
00609     const Type *GetReferenceTarget() const;
00610     const ReferenceType *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00611     const ReferenceType *GetAsUniformType() const;
00612     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00613     const ReferenceType *GetAsConstType() const;
00614     const ReferenceType *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00615 
00616     std::string GetString() const;
00617     std::string Mangle() const;
00618     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const;
00619 
00620     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00621     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00622 
00623 private:
00624     const bool isConst;
00625     const Type * const targetType;
00626 };
00627 
00628 
00629 /** @brief Type representing a function (return type + argument types)
00630 
00631     FunctionType encapsulates the information related to a function's type,
00632     including the return type and the types of the arguments.
00633 
00634     @todo This class has a fair number of methods inherited from Type that
00635     don't make sense here (e.g. IsUniformType(), GetBaseType(), LLVMType(), etc.
00636     Would be nice to refactor the inheritance hierarchy to move most of
00637     those interface methods to a sub-class of Type, which in turn all of
00638     the other Type implementations inherit from.
00639  */
00640 class FunctionType : public Type {
00641 public:
00642     FunctionType(const Type *returnType, 
00643                  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes, SourcePos pos,
00644                  const std::vector<std::string> *argNames = NULL,
00645                  bool isTask = false, bool isExported = false, 
00646                  bool isExternC = false);
00647 
00648     bool IsUniformType() const;
00649     bool IsBoolType() const;
00650     bool IsFloatType() const;
00651     bool IsIntType() const;
00652     bool IsUnsignedType() const;
00653     bool IsConstType() const;
00654 
00655     const Type *GetBaseType() const;
00656     const Type *GetAsVaryingType() const;
00657     const Type *GetAsUniformType() const;
00658     const Type *GetSOAType(int width) const;
00659     const Type *GetAsConstType() const;
00660     const Type *GetAsNonConstType() const;
00661 
00662     std::string GetString() const;
00663     std::string Mangle() const;
00664     std::string GetCDeclaration(const std::string &fname) const;
00665 
00666     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const;
00667     llvm::DIType GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const;
00668 
00669     const Type *GetReturnType() const { return returnType; }
00670 
00671     /** This method returns the LLVM FunctionType that corresponds to this
00672         function type.  The \c includeMask parameter indicates whether the
00673         llvm::FunctionType should have a mask as the last argument in its
00674         function signature. */
00675     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::FunctionType *LLVMFunctionType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, 
00676                                                          bool includeMask = false) const;
00677 
00678     const std::vector<const Type *> &GetArgumentTypes() const { return argTypes; }
00679     const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &GetArgumentDefaults() const { return argDefaults; }
00680     const std::string &GetArgumentName(int i) const { return argNames[i]; }
00681 
00682     /** @todo It would be nice to pull this information together and pass
00683         it when the constructor is called; it's kind of ugly to set it like
00684         this later. */
00685     void SetArgumentDefaults(const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &d) const;
00686 
00687     /** This value is true if the function had a 'task' qualifier in the
00688         source program. */
00689     const bool isTask;
00690 
00691     /** This value is true if the function had a 'export' qualifier in the
00692         source program. */
00693     const bool isExported;
00694 
00695     /** This value is true if the function was declared as an 'extern "C"'
00696         function in the source program. */
00697     const bool isExternC;
00698 
00699 private:
00700     const Type * const returnType;
00701     const std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
00702     /** Default values of the functions arguments.  For arguments without
00703         default values provided, NULL is stored; this means that the length
00704         of this array is the same as the argTypes member, and the i'th
00705         elements of them correspond with each other. */
00706     mutable std::vector<ConstExpr *> argDefaults;
00707     /** The names provided (if any) with the function arguments in the
00708         function's signature.  These should only be used for error messages
00709         and the like and shouldn't affect testing function types for
00710         equality, etc. */
00711     const std::vector<std::string> argNames;
00712     const SourcePos pos;
00713 };
00714 
00715 #endif // ISPC_TYPE_H
